page.title: 03Garway School in 1928
page.content: We went to talk to Mrs Lloyd, who has lived in Garway all her life. When Mrs Lloyd was at school in 1928 she had to walk, and some children used to walk miles to get here. Once a year the children walked from the school to Glanmonnow, about 2 miles away, where they were given a 'treat' of tea followed by games on the lawn. When they got back to school many of the children still had to walk home miles to get to Garway Hill. They used to start school at the same time as us, and if they weren't at school when the bell rang they got into lots of trouble. They did sewing, embroidery, poetry and all the things we do now at school. Mr Wallace, the headmaster, used to take carpentry. They also did gardening. He had a cane that he called Friend John, but it wasn't a friend for the children.
